data:
you make the fire
and I’ll show you something wonderful:
a big ball of snow!
name: A Ball Of Snow
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
A bat flits
in moonlight
above the plum blossoms.
name: A Bat Flits
author: Yosa Buson

data: His death poem:
name: A Bath When You'Re Born
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
A bee
staggers out
of the peony.
name: A Bee
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
A caterpillar,
this deep in fall--
still not a butterfly.
name: A Caterpillar
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
A cicada shell;
it sang itself
utterly away.
name: A Cicada Shell
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
A cold rain starting
And no hat --
So?
name: A Cold Rain Starting
author: Matsuo Basho

data: At a hermitage:
name: A Cool Fall Night
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
a cuckoo cries
and through a thicket of bamboo
the late moon shines
name: A Cuckoo Cries
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
A cuckoo sings
to me, to the mountain,
to me, to the mountain.
name: A Cuckoo Sings
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
A field of cotton--
as if the moon
had flowered.
name: A Field Of Cotton
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
A huge frog and I,
staring at each other,
neither of us moves.
name: A Huge Frog And I
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
All the day long-
yet not long enough for the skylark,
singing, singing.
name: All the day long
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
All the time I pray to Buddha
I keep on
killing mosquitoes.
name: All The Time I Pray To Buddha
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
A man, infirm
With age, slowly sucks
A fish bone.
name: A Man Infirm
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
A monk sips morning tea,
it's quiet,
the chrysanthemum's flowering.
name: A Monk Sips Morning Tea
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
a mosquite buzzes
every time flowers
of honeysuckle fall
name: ?A mosquite buzzes
author: Yosa Buson

data:
old pond.....
a frog leaps in
water's sound
name: An Old Pond
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Asked how old he was,
the boy in the new kimono
stretched out all five fingers.
name: Asked How Old He Was
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
A snowy morning--
by myself,
chewing on dried salmon.
name: A Snowy Morning
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
As they begin to rise again
Chrysanthemums faintly smell,
After the flooding rain
name: As They Begin To Rise Again
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
a strange flower
for birds and butterflies
the autumn sky
name: A Strange Flower
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Autumn moonlight--
a worm digs silently
into the chestnut.
name: Autumn Moonlight
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Awake at night--
the sound of the water jar
cracking in the cold.
name: Awake At Night
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
A weathered skeleton
in windy fields of memory,
piercing like a knife
name: A Weathered Skeleton
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
A wild sea-
In the distance over Sado
The Milky Way
name: A Wild Sea
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The world of dew is, yes,
a world of dew,
but even so
name: A World Of Dew
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Sick on my journey,
only my dreams will wander
these desolate moors
name: Basho's Death
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Before the white chrysanthemum
the scissors hesitate
a moment.
name: Before The White Chrysanthemum
author: Yosa Buson

data: Kori nigaku enso ga nodo o uruoseri
name: Bitter–tasting Ice —
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Blossoms at night,
and the faces of people
moved by music.
name: Blossoms At Night
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Blowing stones
along the road on Mount Asama,
the autumn wind.
name: Blowing Stones
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Blown from the west,
fallen leaves gather
in the east.
name: Blown From The West
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Blow of an ax,
pine scent,
the winter woods.
name: Blow Of An Ax
author: Yosa Buson

data:
brilliant moon
is it true that you too
must pass in a hurry?
name: Brilliant moon
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
bush-clover flowers —
they sway but do not drop
their beads of dew
name: Bush-Clover Flowers
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Bush warbler:
shits on the rice cakes
on the porch rail.
name: Bush Warbler
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
But for a woodpecker
tapping at a post, no sound
at all in the house
name: But For A Woodpecker
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Buying leeks
and walking home
under the bare trees.
name: Buying Leeks
author: Yosa Buson

data:
By the old temple,
peach blossoms;
a man treading rice.
name: By the old temple
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Calligraphy of geese
against the sky--
the moon seals it.
name: Calligraphy Of Geese
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Cedar umbrellas, off
to Mount Yoshimo for
the cherry blossoms.
name: Cedar umbrellas
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Children imitating cormorants
are even more wonderful
than cormorants.
name: Children Imitating Cormorants
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Chilling autumn rains
curtain Mount Fuji, then make it
more beautiful to see
name: Chilling Autumn Rains
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Clouds -
a chance to dodge
moonviewing.
name: Clouds
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Cold as it was
We felt secure sleeping together
In the same room.
name: Cold As It Was
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Cold night: the wild duck,
sick, falls from the sky
and sleeps awhile.
name: Cold Night: The Wild Duck
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Waking in the night;
the lamp is low,
the oil freezing.
name: Collection Of Six Haiku
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Coolness--
the sound of the bell
as it leaves the bell.
name: Coolness
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Coolness of the melons
flecked with mud
in the morning dew.
name: Coolness Of The Melons
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Crossing long fields,
frozen in its saddle,
my shadow creeps by
name: Crossing Long Fields
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Dawn--
fish the cormorants haven't caught
swimming in the shallows.
name: Dawn
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Deep into autumn
and this caterpillar
still not a butterfly
name: Deep Into Autumn
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Don't imitate me;
it's as boring
as the two halves of a melon.
name: Don'T Imitate Me
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Look, don't kill that fly!
It is making a prayer to you
By rubbing its hands and feet.
name: Don'T Kill That Fly!
author: Kobayashi Issa

data: Approaching my village:
name: Don'T Know About The People
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Don't worry, spiders,
I keep house
casually.
name: Don'T Worry, Spiders
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Ducks bobbing on the water--
are they also, tonight,
hoping to get lucky?
name: Ducks Bobbing On The Water
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Early summer rain--
houses facing the river,
two of them.
name: Early Summer Rain
author: Yosa Buson

data:
You left in the morning, at evening my heart is in a
thousand pieces.
Why is it so far away?
name: Elegy To The Old Man Hokuju
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Evening wind:
water laps
the heron's legs.
name: Evening Wind
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Even on the smallest islands,
they are tilling the fields,
skylarks singing.
name: Even On The Smallest Islands
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Even that old horse
is something to see this
snow-covered morning
name: Even That Old Horse
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Even with insects--
some can sing,
some can't.
name: Even With Insects
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Face of the spring moon--
about twelve years old,
I'd say.
name: Face Of The Spring Moon
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
First day of spring--
I keep thinking about
the end of autumn.
name: First Day Of Spring
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
First snow
falling
on the half-finished bridge.
name: First Snow
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
First winter rain--
even the monkey
seems to want a raincoat.
name: First Winter Rain
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Fleas, lice,
a horse peeing
near my pillow.
name: Fleas, Lice
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Flower
under harvest sun - stranger
To bird, butterfly.
name: Flower
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Spring:
A hill without a name
Veiled in morning mist.
name: Four Haiku
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
From time to time
The clouds give rest
To the moon beholders..
name: From Time To Time
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
scent of plum blossoms
on the misty mountain path
a big rising sun
name: Haiku
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The winter river;
down it come floating
flowers offered to Buddha.
name: Haiku
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Harvest moon--
called at his house,
he was digging potatoes.
name: Harvest Moon
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Having slept, the cat gets up,
yawns, goes out
to make love.
name: Having Slept, The Cat Gets Up
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Heat waves shimmering
one or two inches
above the dead grass.
name: Heat Waves Shimmering
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
He's on the porch,
to escape the wife and kids--
how hot it is!
name: He's On The Porch
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Hey, sparrow!
out of the way,
Horse is coming.
name: Hey, Sparrow!
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
His Holiness the Abbot
is shitting
in the withered fields.
name: His Holiness The Abbot
author: Yosa Buson

data: Spring
name: Hokku s In Four Seasons
author: Yosa Buson

data:
How admirable!
to see lightning and not think
life is fleeting.
name: How Admirable
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
How much
are you enjying yourself,
tiger moth?
name: How Much
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
husking rice
a child squints up
to view the moon
name: Husking Rice
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
I'm a wanderer
so let that be my name –
the first winter rain
name: I'M A Wanderer
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
I'm going out,
flies, so relax,
make love.
name: I'M Going Out
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
In spring rain
a pretty girl
yawning.
name: In Spring Rain
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
In these latter-day,
Degenerate times,
Cherry-blossoms everywhere!
name: In These Latter-Day
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
In the thicket's shade
a woman by herself
singing the rice-planting song.
name: In The Thicket's Shade
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
In this world
we walk on the roof of hell,
gazing at flowers.
name: In This World
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Yo no naka wa kutte hako shite nete okite
Sate sono ato wa shinuru bakari zo
name: In This World Of Ours,
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
It is with awe
That I beheld
Fresh leaves, green leaves,
Bright in the sun.
name: It Is With Awe
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
It once happened
that a child was spared punishment
through earnest solicitation.
name: It Once Happened
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Last time, I think,
I'll brush the flies
from my father's face.
name: Last Time, I Think
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Lighting one candle
with another candle--
spring evening.
name: Lighting One Candle
author: Yosa Buson

data:
light of the moon
moves west - flowers' shadows
creep eastward
name: Light Of The Moon
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Listening to the moon,
gazing at the croaking of frogs
in a field of ripe rice.
name: Listening To The Moon
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Long conversations
beside blooming irises –
joys of life on the road
name: Long Conversations
author: Matsuo Basho

data: Remaining hawk
name: Marking The Graves
author: Satish Verma

data:
Midfield,
attached to nothing,
the skylark singing.
name: Midfield
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Moonlight slanting
through the bamboo grove;
a cuckoo crying.
name: Moonlight Slanting
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Morning and evening
Someone waits at Matsushima!
One-sided love
name: Morning And Evening
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
My arm for a pillow,
I really like myself
under the hazy moon.
name: My Arm For A Pillow
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Napped half the day;
no one
punished me!
name: Napped Half The Day
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Napping at midday
I hear the song of rice planters
and feel ashamed of myself.
name: Napping At Midday
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
New Year's Day--
everything is in blossom!
I feel about average.
name: New Year's Day
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
New Year's morning:
the ducks on the pond
quack and quack.
name: New Year's Morning
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
No doubt about it,
the mountain cuckoo
is a crybaby.
name: No Doubt About It
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
None is travelling
Here along this way but I,
This autumn evening.
name: None Is Travelling
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Not knowing
it's a tub they're in
the fish cooling at the gate.
name: Not Knowing
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Not quite dark yet
and the stars shining
above the withered fields.
name: Not Quite Dark Yet
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Not very anxious
to bloom,
my plum tree.
name: Not Very Anxious
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Now the swinging bridge
is quieted with creepers
like our tendrilled life
name: Now the swinging bridge
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Old well,
a fish leaps--
dark sound.
name: Old Well
author: Yosa Buson

data:
On Buddha's deathday,
wrinkled tough old hands pray –
the prayer beads' sound
name: On Buddha's Deathday
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
On New Year's Day
each thought a loneliness
as winter dusk descends
name: On New Year's Day
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
On the cow shed
A hard winter rain;
Cock crowing.
name: On The Cow Shed
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
On the white poppy,
a butterfly’s torn wing
is a keepsake
name: On The White Poppy
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
On this road
where nobody else travels
autumn nightfall
name: On This Road
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Over-ripe sushi,
The Master
Is full of regret.
name: Over-Ripe Sushi
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Passing through the world
Indeed this is just
Sogi's rain shelter
name: Passing Through The World
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Petals of the mountain rose
Fall now and then,
To the sound of the waterfall?
name: Petals Of The Mountain Rose
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Pissing in the snow
outside my door--
it makes a very straight hole.
name: Pissing In The Snow
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Ploughing the land--
not even a bird singing
in the mountain's shadow.
name: Ploughing The Land
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Scarecrow in the hillock
Paddy field --
How unaware! How useful.
name: Scarecrow In The Hillock
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Seen
through a telescope:
ten cents worth of fog.
name: Seen
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Sleep on horseback,
The far moon in a continuing dream,
Steam of roasting tea.
name: Sleep On Horseback
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
souls' festival
today also there is smoke
from the crematory
name: Souls' Festival
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Sparrow singing--
its tiny mouth
open.
name: Sparrow Singing
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Spring rain:
telling stories,
a straw coat and umbrella walk past
name: Spring Rain
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Spring rain
leaking through the roof
dripping from the wasps' nest.
name: Spring Rain
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Staying at an inn
where prostitutes are also sleeping--
bush clover and the moon.
name: Staying At An Inn
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Stillness--
the cicada's cry
drills into the rocks.
name: Stillness
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Straw sandal half sunk
in an old pond
in the sleety snow.
name: Straw Sandal Half Sunk
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Summer night--
even the stars
are whispering to each other.
name: Summer Night
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Taking a nap,
feet planted
against a cool wall.
name: Taking A Nap
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Teeth sensitive to the sand
in salad greens--
I'm getting old.
name: Teeth Sensitive To The Sand
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Temple bells die out.
The fragrant blossoms remain.
A perfect evening!
name: Temple Bells Die Out
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
That pretty girl--
munching and rustling
the wrapped-up rice cake.
name: That Pretty Girl
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
That wren--
looking here, looking there.
You lose something?
name: That Wren
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
The banana tree
blown by winds pours raindrops
into the bucket
name: The Banana Tree
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The behavior of the pigeon
is beyond reproach,
but the mountain cuckoo?
name: The Behavior Of The Pigeon
author: Yosa Buson

data:
The butterfly is perfuming
It's wings in the scent
Of the orchid.
name: The Butterfly
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The clouds come and go,
providing a rest for all
the moon viewers
name: The Clouds Come And Go
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The crow
walks along there
as if it were tilling the field.
name: The Crow
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
The dragonfly
can't quite land
on that blade of grass.
name: The Dragonfly
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The end of spring--
the poet is brooding
about editors.
name: The End Of Spring
author: Yosa Buson

data:
The first snow
the leaves of the daffodil
bending together
name: The First Snow
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The man pulling radishes
pointed my way
with a radish.
name: The Man Pulling Radishes
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
The moon tonight--
I even miss
her grumbling.
name: The Moon Tonight
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
The morning glories
bloom, securing the gate
in the old fence
name: The Morning Glories
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The morning glory also
turns out
not to be my friend.
name: The Morning Glory Also
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Behind this door
Now buried in deep grass
A different generation will celebrate
The Festival of Dolls.
name: The Narrow Road To The Deep North: Prologue
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The oak tree:
not interested
in cherry blossoms.
name: The Oak Tree
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The old man
cutting barley--
bent like a sickle.
name: The Old Man
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Following are several translations
of the 'Old Pond' poem, which may be
the most famous of all haiku:
name: The Old Pond
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The passing spring
Birds mourn,
Fishes weep
With tearful eyes.
name: The Passing Spring
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The petals tremble
on the yellow mountain rose –
roar of the rapids
name: The Petals Tremble
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The pheasant cries
as if it just noticed
the mountain.
name: The Pheasant Cries
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
These sea slugs,
they just don't seem
Japanese.
name: These Sea Slugs
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
The shallows –
a crane’s thighs splashed
in cool waves
name: The Shallows
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The she cat -
Grown thin
From love and barley.
name: The She Cat
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The snow is melting
and the village is flooded
with children.
name: The Snow Is Melting
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
The spring sea rising
and falling, rising
and falling all day.
name: The Spring Sea Rising
author: Yosa Buson

data:
The squid seller's call
mingles with the voice
of the cuckoo.
name: The Squid Seller's Call
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The toad! It looks like
it could belch
a cloud.
name: The Toad! It Looks Like
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
the warbler sings
among new shoots of bamboo
of coming old age
name: The Warbler Sings
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
the whole family
all with white hair and canes
visiting graves
name: The Whole Family
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The willow leaves fallen,
the spring gone dry,
rocks here and there.
name: The Willow Leaves Fallen
author: Yosa Buson

data:
The winter leeks
Have been washed white --
How cold it is!
name: The Winter Leeks
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The winter storm
Hid in the bamboo grove
And quieted away.
name: The Winter Storm
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The wren
Earns his living
Noiselessly.
name: The Wren
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
They end their flight
one by one---
crows at dusk.
name: They End Their Flight
author: Yosa Buson

data:
This first fallen snow
is barely enough to bend
the jonquil leaves
name: This First Fallen Snow
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
This moth saw brightness
in a woman's chamber--
burnt to a crisp.
name: This Moth Saw Brightness
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
This old village--
not a single house
without persimmon trees.
name: This Old Village
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
tilling the field:
the man who asked the way
has disappeared
name: Tilling the field
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Tremble, oh my gravemound,
in time my cries will be
only this autumn wind
name: Tremble Oh My Gravemound
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Under my house
an inchworm
measuring the joists.
name: Under My House
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
under my tree-roof
slanting lines of april rain
separate to drops
name: Under My Tree-Roof
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
She's as thick as a beetle
As fearlessness as battle
Her boldness protrudes
Like appendages of a spider.
name: Underneath Her Web
author: Vincent Onyeche

data:
Under the image of Buddha
all these spring flowers
seem a little tiresome.
name: Under The Image Of Buddha
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Ungraciously, under
a great soldier's empty helmet,
a cricket sings
name: Ungraciously
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
The summer grasses
All that remains
Of brave soldiers dreams
name: Untitled
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Below are eleven Buson haiku
beginning with the phrase
'The short night--'
name: Variations On 'The Short Night--'
author: Yosa Buson

data:
Visiting the graves,
the old dog
leads the way.
name: Visiting The Graves
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Washing the hoe--
ripples on the water;
far off, wild ducks.
name: Washing The Hoe
author: Yosa Buson

data:
What a strange thing!
to be alive
beneath cherry blossoms.
name: What A Strange Thing
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
What fish feel,
birds feel, I don't know--
the year ending.
name: What Fish Feel
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
When the winter chrysanthemums go,
there's nothing to write about
but radishes.
name: When The Winter Chrysanthemums Go
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
White blossoms of the pear
and a woman in moonlight
reading a letter.
name: White Blossoms Of The Pear
author: Yosa Buson

data:
At my daughter's grave, thirty days
after her death:
name: Windy Fall
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Winter downpour -
even the monkey
needs a raincoat.
name: Winter Downpour
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Winter garden,
the moon thinned to a thread,
insects singing.
name: Winter Garden
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Winter seclusion –
sitting propped against
the same worn post
name: Winter Seclusion
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Winter seclusion -
Listening, that evening,
To the rain in the mountain.
name: Winter Seclusion
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Winter solitude--
in a world of one color
the sound of wind.
name: Winter Solitude
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
With a warbler for
a soul, it sleeps peacefully,
this mountain willo
name: With A Warbler
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
With every gust of wind,
the butterfly changes its place
on the willow.
name: With Every Gust Of Wind
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
With my father
I would watch dawn
over green fields.
name: With My Father
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Won't you come and see
loneliness? Just one leaf
from the kiri tree.
name: Won't You Come And See
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Wrapping dumplings in
bamboo leaves, with one finger
she tidies her hair
name: Wrapping Dumplings
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Wrapping the rice cakes,
with one hand
she fingers back her hair.
name: Wrapping The Rice Cakes
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
Writing shit about new snow
for the rich
is not art.
name: Writing Shit About New Snow
author: Kobayashi Issa

data:
Year’s end, all
corners of this
floating world, swept.
name: Year’s End,
author: Matsuo Basho

data:
One winter morning–
It will all be over,
For humanity.
name: One winter morning
author: Chris Hart

data:
One hundred islands in winter,
A fiery archipelago:
Clouds at sunset.
name: One hundred islands in winter
author: Chris Hart

data:
Falling blossoms in spring
Lying on the cold wet ground
That I had just swept.
name: Falling blossoms in spring
author: Chris Hart

data:
Midnight is looming
My heart flutters uselessly
The past stays silent
--42
name: 42nights
author: Jesse Cheesman
